body.p: The IASB considered that, overall, a foreign currency basis spread could be considered as a charge to convert one currency into another. Consequently, the IASB agreed that the foreign currency basis spread could be subsumed under the notion of ‘costs of hedging’ that it had developed for the accounting for the time value of options and the forward element of forward contracts. The IASB therefore decided to expand the notion of ‘costs of hedging’ so as to include foreign currency basis spreads. In the IASB’s view, this would provide the most transparent accounting, reflect best the economics of the transaction and fit into the new hedge accounting model.
